text: was a Japanese shogun of the Edo period. His rule started in 1603 and ended in 1605. He is one of the most famous military commanders in Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tokugawa Ieyasu" in Japan Encyclopedia, pp. 977-978. ==Early life== At birth, his name was Matsudaira Takechiyo. In 1562, he changed his name to Matsudaira Motoyasu. The second syllable -- -yasu -- comes from the name of his grandfather Kiyoyasu.Sadler, Arthur Lindsay. (2010). The Maker of Modern Japan: The Life of Tokugawa Ieyasu, p. 51. A few months later, he changed his first name to the one by which he is known today. The first syllable -- Ie- -- comes from the last part of the name of Minamoto Yoshile, who was a famous ancestor.Sadler, p. 70. He received permission from the emperor to change his family name from Matsudaira to Tokugawa.Janse, Marius B. (2002). The Making of Modern Japan, p. 29. ==Shogun== Ieyasu was the first shogun of the Tokugawa shogunate. ==References== ==Other websites== * "Tokugawa Ieyasu (1542-1616)" at BBC History Category:Shoguns Category:1543 births Category:1616 deaths Category:People from Aichi Prefecture
